issue.title: Whether forced "copy to VRAM" is required

issue.title: [Sonic Adventure(NTSC/USA)] Audio is heavily distorted during action level.
issue.body:
**Platform / OS / Hardware:** X86_64 GNU/Linux, Debian 12

**Github hash:** https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/commit/e55d70c0e6bc09a0ee6d7b8cae3136bb66af537c

**Hardware:** I5 1235U with Intel XE graphics, latest MESA GitLab code.

**Description of the Issue**

Audio in Sonic Adventure (NTSC/USA) is heavily distorted on the first level.
Until that point (intros, animations..) everything seems fine.

**Debugging Steps Tested**

I have tried enabling and disabling DSP emulation, but that makes no difference.

**Screenshots**

Since this is an audio issue, I recorded a small video of it:

https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/assets/837585/fab6516f-0226-4a40-8489-6805c3838a91

comment.body: Confirmed and it is a consequence of dac5b991e07150880f685e5ed167cda5e8994039

issue.title: Games on External storage(SDCARD) feel slow
issue.body:
VIVO y91/Android 8/

Add a short, concise description of the issue here
 Hello devs a i have problem in games when playing it on my sdcard. i dontb have any storage on my internal storage so i add my games on my new sdcard, its a gift for me. but its so slow and theres a lag when playing my games on sdcard. is theres a way to fix it??

sorry for bad english

comment.body: Its lagging on DEAD OR ALIVE 2 but in other maps only, but when the game is in my internal storage, a little bit good performance change but still lagging

issue.title: Golem no Maigo - Noise occurs when selecting a stage
issue.body:
Platform / OS / Hardware: 
Windows11 / i7-10700F / GTX 1660 SUPER

Github hash: d3a3cab

Selecting any stage will cause noise.
[SaveState](https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/files/11342882/Golem.no.Maigo.zip)

comment.body: It looks like a GD-ROM timing issue: the audio data written to audio RAM is first read from the GD-ROM. By artificially slowing down the GD-ROM transfer speed, I can almost eliminate the white noise. It's likely that adding spin up time and/or seek time would make the issue go away.

issue.title: [Vulkan] [Daytona USA 2001] Cars have missing surfaces
issue.body:
Platform / OS / Hardware:  X86_64 GNU/Linux, Debian 12

Github hash: e55d70c0e6bc09a0ee6d7b8cae3136bb66af537c

Hardware: I5 1235U with Intel XE graphics, latest MESA GitLab code.

**_Description of the Issue_**

Cars in Daytona USA 2001 have missing surfaces as they rotate in the car select menu or in-game.

**_Debugging Steps Tested_**

I have tried the different **Transparent Sorting** modes available.
The picture below is taken with the default **Per Triangle**.
With **Per Strip** even more parts are missing, and with **Per Pixel** there are car no surfaces missing but there are other artifacts on the tracks (hard to take a picture, they happen very fast).
 
**_Screenshots_**
![daytonaaaa](https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/assets/837585/89849211-2ab9-456a-842a-c99514d51fd4)

comment.body: Thanks a lot! Now I perfectly understand and everything is fine on my hardware.

issue.title: Games on External storage(SDCARD) feel slow
issue.body:
VIVO y91/Android 8/

Add a short, concise description of the issue here
 Hello devs a i have problem in games when playing it on my sdcard. i dontb have any storage on my internal storage so i add my games on my new sdcard, its a gift for me. but its so slow and theres a lag when playing my games on sdcard. is theres a way to fix it??

sorry for bad english

comment.body:
There's normally few accesses to the GD-ROM when in game. And even with a slow card, it's still MUCH faster than the original dreamcast GD-ROM drive (1.8 MB/s max).

When do you feel the lag? What happens? Which games?

issue.title: [Vulkan] [Daytona USA 2001] Cars have missing surfaces
issue.body:
Platform / OS / Hardware:  X86_64 GNU/Linux, Debian 12

Github hash: e55d70c0e6bc09a0ee6d7b8cae3136bb66af537c

Hardware: I5 1235U with Intel XE graphics, latest MESA GitLab code.

**_Description of the Issue_**

Cars in Daytona USA 2001 have missing surfaces as they rotate in the car select menu or in-game.

**_Debugging Steps Tested_**

I have tried the different **Transparent Sorting** modes available.
The picture below is taken with the default **Per Triangle**.
With **Per Strip** even more parts are missing, and with **Per Pixel** there are car no surfaces missing but there are other artifacts on the tracks (hard to take a picture, they happen very fast).
 
**_Screenshots_**
![daytonaaaa](https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/assets/837585/89849211-2ab9-456a-842a-c99514d51fd4)

comment.body:
Yes, sorry about that. "Native Depth Interpolation" is required for AMD but it also helps Intel GPUs with some games. And Daytona USA is one of them.
It has no impact on performance.

commits.message:
arm32: fix host rounding mode on android

It looks like setting host rounding stopped working on armv7 android a
while ago (v1.0 already has the issue). Directly setting the host FPSCR
register doesn't work so use the C99 standard functions fegetenv and
fesetenv instead.
Fixes flickering yoshimitsu legs in Soul Calibur.
Fixes rotating objects in Sword of the Berserk.
Issue #556
Issue #1259

gl: disable dithering with GLES 2.0

GLES 2.0 doesn't allow initialization of const arrays.
Fixes MINIDUMP-1YP MINIDUMP-1YQ

gl: frame upside down with GLES 2.0 if video shift is on

drawQuad ignores the swapY param if vertices are provided so swap Y
coords of vertices.

gl oit: fix several issues

Disable blending when rendering a-buffers. Fixes ECW Anarchy Rulz black
title screen and Demolition Racer glitchy end of race screen.

Use palette in the depth pass for punch-through polygons using palette
texture. Fixes shadow issue in Alone in the Dark.

Copy ouput fbo to geom_fbo before drawing. Fixes missing transparent
polygons in subsequent partial renders. Fixes Test Drive Le Mans missing
labels in loading screen.

Issue #1262

issue.title: F355 Challenge - When using DX9, the screen blinks when the window size is made larger than the default size
issue.body:
Platform / OS / Hardware: 
Windows11 / i7-10700F / GTX 1660 SUPER

Github hash: e55d70c

The screen blinking was confirmed from caec338.

Cable: composite
Show VMUs
DX9 per-strip

Launch the game with the default 640x480 window size.
On the title screen, drag the right edge of the screen slightly with your mouse. (or change to full screen)
(If you change to full screen, the VMU icon will try to fit within the 4:3 screen.)

Then the screen and VMU icon will flash in sync with "PRESS START BUTTON".

comment.body:
I confirmed that when flycast is started on "Intel HD Graphics 4000" it does not blink, but when started on "GTX650" it blinks.
I have also confirmed that older notebook PCs equipped with "Mobile Intel 4 series Express Chipset Family" do not blink in the same way.

This seems to occur with the nvidia driver.

**DX9 per-strip** (The window size is set to 840x480. The position of the VMU icon is incorrect.)

https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/assets/14366233/72ca6231-3ad4-4097-88be-196813fcb9a1

issue.title: [PowerVR] Soulcalibur & Sword of berserk animation glitches
issue.body:
**Please Note: This form is the minimum required information for submitting bugs.**  
**Removing this form may lead to your issue being closed until it is completed.**

Platform / OS / Hardware: andriod vulkan/opengl3.2

Github hash:

Hardware:
PvrGE8320 helio g25 32bits 2gb ram 32gbrom


Issue description
Animation glitches that looks sweet



* screenshots*
![Screenshot_2022-03-05-17-48-12-067_com flycast emulator](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100472534/156884216-6bb12ab0-1ddb-4d31-a0a2-d858dbe784c2.jpg)
![Screenshot_2022-03-05-21-00-54-065_com google android youtube](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100472534/156884217-61a9a54c-f6cb-48b2-99a5-9efa2c10cb70.jpg)

comment.body:
This looks like a floating point rounding issue. I can reproduce it on x64 by ignoring the SH4 rounding mode.
However this always happen on arm32 platforms, including running 32-bit code on aarch64.
Advanced SIMD instructions ignore the rounding mode (always round to nearest) but "almost" all VFP instructions honor it. The dynarec normally only uses VFP instructions when rounding is involved.
This isn't a regression (reicast has the same issue).
